posts.author: Kermit
posts.title: Merry Christmas to you in Minnesota!

posts.raw_content:
Another year gone by, another holiday family interaction, another reflection on the ones who Still Don't Get It.

Last summer, the grizzly uncle (Gran Torino, with TDS) said "I don't like the way she plays the race card, but you have to admit-- she's smart," about Joy Reid.     

That mind-blowing seed-- grew into this Post.   No, I don't think she's smart.   But suppose I accept the premise that she is?  Doesn't that just put the culpability squarely on her?  I'm sayin', if she's Smart Enough to understand the consequences of spewing anti-white shit/ then she's smart enough to stop handing elections to Donald Trump, by shitting on whites on TV.

So: you can defeat Donald Trump.  Or you can keep Joy Reid.  But you can't have both.

On Thanksgiving, same uncle, brought-up RFK Jr. out of the blue.  He alleged that "Trump's entire family has been getting rich, off corrupt deals!"  ...a claim which I'm willing to hear him try to back-up.    

But, first, I said, "for the last few years-- you said 'I don't care, he's not the President.  He's just the President's son!," whenever I mentioned Hunter Biden.  By your standard, Trump's family doesn't matter. 

"Hunter Biden is just one-drug addict, who got a job in Ukraine from his daddy's name!  That's all he did, except do drugs. With Trump it's his Whole Family!"       I said, "Can you even name Biden's siblings? Do you know about the man Frank Biden killed drunk driving, then refused to pay the court judgement to his young daughters? James Biden's fishy deals, Valerie Biden's role as the behind-the-scenes family fixer?    And Hunter Biden did more than Burisma-- he flew to China with his father on Air Force Two, arranged a handshake with a CCP Oligarch, then inked a Billion Dollar Deal to have exclusive access to an entire economic development zone, where no other foreigners were allowed to do business."

In response, uncle took evasive action, leaping into a non-sequitur-- "JFK!  JFK!  You shouldn't take medical advice from that crazy idiot!"   I hate seeing the tough old guy betrayed by his own brain.  Trying to pivot from an argument about a political-dynasty riding on their family name-- by switching to talking about THE KENNEDYS.   And then accidentally garbling RFK Jr.'s, name-- instead literally shouting "JFK!" dripping with hate against your own party's martyred saint.  Dang.

You gotta pick.  You can get-around to finally making whatever case it-was, that Trump's family are corrupt.  But you gotta let poor poor Hunter eat some long-overdue consequences, too.  And the Clintons, the Obamas, the Kennedys, Pelosi's , Cuomo's.   Or don't turn-over any of those stones, I guess.   But it doesn't work to be selectively outraged.

A week before Christmas: a relative is in the hospital for heart surgery, an update phone call about that-- is interjected-with a remark against ICE wearing masks.    Ol' Gran Torino doesn't like the smelly Vietnamese fish market which came to his town after the war.  Or the Mexican gangsters who populate his old high school.  Or the strange Africans, or hostile Arabs.   (He does still believe Indians Make Good Doctors, thinking himself lucky-- when he gets-one at the VA.)      But he gets all his news from teevee-- so he's been brainwashed to give a fuck about whether ICE officers wear masks.   "Not being able to identify them!" leads him into a rant about due-process.   And he picks Kilmar Abrego-Garcia his example.  

I say, "the MS-13 guy?"    He claims it "hasn't been proven" those are MS-13 tattoos, "and, look, they're sending him to all these countries, having all these court hearings."    I say, "yeah-- and we're supposed to do that 10 million times, just to get rid of all the bad ones?!"  He said, "It doesn't matter.  Prisoners on death row get 50 years of appeals sometimes, before we execute them."    I replied, "Well-- then we're never getting rid of them.  But you get to feel good about giving them 'Their Rights'."   

He didn't like that.  He finally quit digging that hole.  Might take him a while to conveniently-forget that point; by getting mad about some-other irrelevant shit.

Christmas: He invited me to tangle, by raising some awful claim against Trump.   I don't remember what it was.   But it didn't work, because I agreed with whatever-it-was.  "Yeah, that was a fucked-up thing to say about Rob Reiner's murder," or whatever.     From that, he concluded, "See!, Even The Trump-Lovers Don't Defend Him, Anymore!   The Republicans are going to get crushed in the midterms!"   I didn't push back: "Maybe so.  If you trust polls-- I saw one that says Trump's popularity has dropped 19% in suburbs, since the Election."   

He reversed his position, "Most Trump cult members won't stop supporting him, no matter how bad he is!"    I guess he got confused.  He was in the mood to fight & I didn't give him anything to fight over, so he switched to the opposite position.  "I guess we'll see how it goes, next year," I offered.  --not enough resistance/ to give him the fight he was looking-forward to.   

What happened next was predictable, but I didn't see it coming.  He wasn't pleased at all-- that I had seemingly come-closer to his position on Trump. Depriving him of our regularly-scheduled argument.   If you want to defeat Donald Trump, you gotta "take the Win," when it comes your way.  Be glad that your damn nephew shares this-or-that opinion with you.

For the rest of the conversation-- rather than taking shots at Trump.   He interpreted everything I said uncharitably-- as an opportunity to take shots at me.  I became the new object of his Derangement.  He just wants to Hate Someone.  If it can't be Trump, I'll do.   I'm talking about stuff like-- telling him the eyeglasses I ordered online only cost $20.  He said "that's impossible", said I was "exaggerating".  I showed him the website.  He grumbled.

Ok-- but if you want to defeat Donald Trump-- that ain't gonna help.
posts.author: CaptainCuomo
posts.title: How to Defeat Donald Trump: (don't worry, it's ok to Just Tell Them.  They never take the advice.)
